response:
Here is the adjusted clinical note in HTML format: ```html Clinical Note

Summary:
Female, 22 years old, BMI 40, heavy menstrual bleeding, pelvic pain
Two prior pregnancies with cesarean sections, history of PCOS, appendectomy

Body:
The 22-year-old female nurse presents with heavy menstrual bleeding and pelvic pain, with a history of PCOS, two cesarean sections, and an appendectomy. Examination reveals an enlarged uterus suggestive of fibroids, warranting further evaluation with an ultrasound to confirm the diagnosis. Treatment options may include medication for bleeding control or surgical intervention like myomectomy. Addressing PCOS is crucial for menstrual cycle regulation.

Plan:
1. Perform an ultrasound to confirm fibroids. (Uptodate - 2025 - Uterine fibroids (leiomyomas) Treatment overview - UpToDate)
2. Consider medication for bleeding control. (GTG 2014 - Endometrial Hyperplasia)
3. Discuss the possibility of a myomectomy for severe cases. (Uptodate - 2025 - Uterine fibroids (leiomyomas) Treatment overview - UpToDate)
4. Refer to a gynecologist for further management of fibroids and PCOS. (GTG 2014 - Endometrial Hyperplasia)

``` Guidelines used: 1. Obesity with BMI 40 - BJOG - 2018 - Denison - Care of Women with Obesity in Pregnancy 2. Heavy menstrual bleeding - GTG 2014 - Endometrial Hyperplasia 3. Possible uterine fibroids - Uptodate - 2025 - Uterine fibroids (leiomyomas) Treatment overview - UpToDate
